definition: A type of machine learning where the model is trained on labeled data to predict outputs.
A type of machine learning where the model is trained on unlabeled data to discover patterns.
A subset of machine learning that uses neural networks to analyze data.
A type of machine learning model inspired by the human brain.
A field of study that focuses on the interaction between computers and humans in natural language.
A type of machine learning where the model learns through trial and error by interacting with an environment.
A type of deep learning model trained on vast amounts of text data to generate human-like language.
A type of AI system that can perceive its environment and take actions to achieve goals.
A type of AI model that uses retrieval mechanisms to generate text based on external knowledge sources.
A type of AI model that combines the capabilities of agents and RAG to generate text based on external knowledge sources and take actions.
A type of AI architecture that uses multiple components to process and generate text.
A type of AI system that enables communication and interaction between multiple agents.
The surrounding information or situation that helps to disambiguate and understand the meaning of text or data.
The ability of an AI system to store and retrieve information over time.
A piece of text or input that is used to guide or initiate the generation of text or actions by an AI system.
A fully managed service for building, training, and deploying machine learning models.
A deep learning-based image and video analysis service.
example: Image and video analysis, facial recognition

definition: A natural language processing service for text analysis and insights.
example: Text analysis, sentiment analysis, entity recognition

definition: A service for building conversational interfaces.
A Python SDK for interacting with AWS services.
A cloud-based platform for building, training, and deploying machine learning models.
A set of cloud-based APIs for building intelligent applications.
example: Computer vision, speech recognition, natural language processing

definition: A cloud-based API for image analysis and processing.
A cloud-based API for natural language processing.
A Python SDK for interacting with Azure services.
A managed platform for building, training, and deploying machine learning models.
A cloud-based API for image analysis and processing.
A cloud-based API for natural language processing.
A cloud-based API for speech recognition.

concept: Google Cloud Client Library for Python
definition: A Python SDK for interacting with Google Cloud services.
A framework for building autonomous agents.
A framework for building conversational interfaces.
A framework for building applications with large language models.
A framework for building applications with large language models.
A library for building and fine-tuning transformer models.
Anthropic's Claude variant and tools optimized for code generation, understanding, and reasoning.
example: Automated code generation, code review, explain-and-refactor

definition: Command-line tools and client libraries to interact with Google's Gemini generative models and Vertex AI services.
example: Generate text or images, run local prompts via CLI, manage model calls

definition: Anthropic's family of large language models (Claude) designed for safe and helpful conversational AI and reasoning tasks.
OpenAI's family of generative pretrained transformer models for natural language understanding and generation.
An open API/router that proxies and routes requests to multiple LLM providers, providing a unified interface and billing options.
example: Switching between model providers, unified API for multi-provider deployments

definition: A community-oriented tooling concept for open, collaborative code generation and sharing workflows.
example: Shared code templates, community-driven code generation

definition: A lightweight code-assistant concept/tool (assumed) for quick code snippets, completion, and developer tooling integration.
example: IDE plugin for inline code suggestions, snippet management

definition: Command-line tooling and client wrappers to interact with OpenAI's Codex models for code generation and analysis.
example: Generate functions, explain code, run prompt-driven code generation from terminal

definition: A lightweight remote procedure call protocol encoded in JSON, used for inter-process and networked method invocation.
example: Blockchain node APIs, language server protocol transports
